intro: Aeollanthus cryptanthus, commonly known as the cryptanthus aeollanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or greenish flowers that bloom in late summer. Its roots are thick and fleshy, adapted to store water in its native, high-altitude environment. Aeollanthus cryptanthus is often grown as an ornamental plant for its unique foliage and resilience in cooler climates.
